definition: To move or agitate something rapidly back and forth, typically by hand or with force, often to mix or blend its contents or to express a strong emotion. It is commonly used when referring to shaking a container or vigorously shaking one's head to indicate disagreement or disbelief.

examples.german: Ich schüttele den Saft vor dem Trinken.
examples.english: I shake the juice before drinking.

examples.german: Er schüttelte den Kopf, um Nein zu sagen.
examples.english: He shook his head to say no.

examples.german: Die Hände schütteln sich zur Begrüßung.
examples.english: The hands shake each other in greeting.

examples.german: Der Hund schüttelt sich, um das Wasser abzuschütteln.
examples.english: The dog shakes itself to shake off the water.

examples.german: Sie schüttelte den Teppich aus dem Fenster.
examples.english: She shook the carpet out of the window.
